headline: Vegan Cupcakes
description: These vegan cupcakes flavored with vanilla are egg-free, made with almond milk and coconut oil, and are quick to make with basic pantry ingredients.

video.description: Dairy-free cupcakes flavored with vanilla extract and coconut oil.
video.name: Vegan Cupcakes

name: Vegan Cupcakes
recipeIngredient: 0.5 cup coconut oil, warmed until liquid

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease two 12-cup muffin pans or line with 18 paper baking cups.
Pour apple cider vinegar into a 2-cup measuring cup. Fill with almond milk to make 1 1/2 cups. Let stand until curdled, about 5 minutes.

Whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl. Whisk together almond milk mixture, coconut oil, and vanilla in a separate bowl. Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and stir just until blended. Spoon batter evenly into the prepared cups.
Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, 15 to 20 minutes. Cool in the pan set over a wire rack.
Arrange cooled cupcakes on a serving platter. Frost with desired frosting.

review.reviewBody: This cupcake has a very fluffy texture and a punchy batter that I don't usually find in other recipes. I use sunflower oil and golden sugar. Also added fresh juice and zest on 1 big lemon but I didn't feel it neither the vanilla (although my vanilla extract is quite good). That's why I give 4 stars. Next time I'll add more. Otherwise, it's a keep one! Thank you!
Super fluffy cupcakes!!! I brought up temp of coconut milk and oil in warming oven. I will frost with a (V) üçì cream icing. Definitely will make again xo

I made these for my vegan friend, modifying the dry ingredients a bit to make chocolate cupcakes (a little less flour, add cocoa powder). I got a decent rise on my cupcakes and the texture was excellent -- moist and not too dense. I thought they were good for being vegan, but I think the coconut oil is too overpowering. It tastes like a coconut cupcake. Next time I would try a neutral oil like canola or vegetable.

The best vegan vanilla cupcakes I‚Äôve tasted so far! I needed to make some for a couple of birthday parties we will be attending since I didn‚Äôt want my young food-allergy son to feel left out. Some specifics: I used sweetened soy milk, canola oil, and King Arthur all purpose flour. I read that another baker allowed the measured milk to sit out to reach room temperature‚Äîdon‚Äôt forget this step! I sprayed my cupcake liners with olive oil and filled them 3/4 which made the full 18 cupcakes; if you fill less you could probably get close to 24. I did need to bake them for 20 minutes (the first one I tasted after 17 minutes was a little gooey in the middle top). I will be saving and reusing this recipe probably hundreds of times in the years to come. Thank you for sharing!

I‚Äôve made this recipe twice now for my vegan friend‚Äôs kid. The first time I used vanilla, the second time orange zest and juice for flavor. Both times they came out great! If you set out the almond milk and vinegar to curdle first before doing anything else, it has time to come to room temperature and not solidify the coconut oil right away. If you add the liquid ingredients to the dry ingredients as soon as they are combined you shouldn‚Äôt have any problems with the oil.

Great recipe! I used lemon instead of vinegar, subbed in about 1/3 of the flour with cocoa powder, used almond extract because I was out of vanilla and added in some chocolate chips. Will definitely make again.

So delicious!!! Made these for a recent family gathering and they were a huge hit among the vegans and non-vegans (myself included)! The only ingredient change I made was to replace the apple cider vinegar with yuzu juice and they ended up baking for closer to 22 minutes at 350 degrees F.
LOVED IT. Used butter olive oil instead of coconut oil and oat mill with 1tsp almond extract instead of alm9nd milk. Yum

I have made this recipe multiple times, and every time it seems to taste better! I totally recommend this recipe to everyone! Try it out! Although, you may want to add a bit less sugar. The rest is AMAZING! ENJOY!

This is truly an amazing recipe. It's my first time at baking vegan and it was a total success! It's super easy to prepare and the cupcakes were moist and flavorful. I even enjoyed licking the raw batter from the spatula after I poured it in the cupcake papers. This is an ideal recipe to teach to junior high and high school students; so as to encourage them to bake healthier. A+++ for the author of this recipe!
I made this as is the

10 STARS **********
This was the cupcake BEST recipe ever. Came out perfectly. Thank you so much.
I added water instead of almond milk and did not have baking soda, so I just used baking powder and it still came out great. Hubby likes them too. Will make them again.

I have tried many different vegan cupcake/cake recipes over the year. This is a new favorite. I followed the directions exactly, with the exception of using coconut milk instead of almond milk. I added some chocolate chips to the batter and used vegan neopolitan frosting. They were a hit. Will make again.
This recipe was amazing!! My whole family loved it and couldn‚Äôt believe it was vegan
I made these exactly as they are, and everyone loved them! Vegan or not! I even made a chocolate version by throwing in cocoa, as one of the reviews stated! Very delicious!

I tried this recipe for the first time and made it for a Halloween party, and the results were amazing! I actually used this recipe for my cake pops instead of cupcakes and they came out perfect!! I totally recommend this to others! Thank You!

These are very good and the recipe is very flexible, I made it with 1 and 3/4 of self rising flour and 1/4 of coconut flour; it could definitely be made with less sugar, especially if you plan on using icing

I‚Äôm not vegan but I have a friend who is so I wanted to make something sweet I could share with her. These. Are. AMAZING! They‚Äôre not too far off in texture from non-vegan cupcakes. They‚Äôre moist, not too dense, and perfectly sweet. Just make sure you heat the milk (I used vanilla soy milk, which also adds a little bit to the vanilla flavor!) before you add the warmed coconut oil, as it would likely re-solidify if you were to add it to room-temperature milk. This probably should have been mentioned in the instructions, since not everyone is used to baking with coconut oil. Other than that, the recipe was easy to follow and didn‚Äôt take much time to complete at all, and the result tastes sooo good! With some vegan buttercream these will very well be the best cupcakes I‚Äôve ever made!
Amazing! Turned out like REAL Cupcakes!! Would recommend! Here‚Äôs a tip put all dry ingredients then wet!

We made rainbow cupcakes with this recipe for my daughter‚Äôs birthday and they turned out great! I was a little worried they wouldn‚Äôt rise as much since I had to manipulate the batter so much mixing the different colors, but they rose up perfectly! I used canola oil instead of coconut oil, and coconut milk instead of almond milk. They were delicious! Non-vegans would never know the difference!
Followed the recipe to the T, came out AMAZING! I was so worried since I've never made vegan cupcakes before. Already making them again!

So much fun! We chose this recipe because we didn't have eggs. But, somehow we had apple cider vinegar. We substituted the coconut oil with vegetable oil. We love it!! we were able to shspe them into hearts and add a nice buttercream frosting. super yummy.
This is the best recipe. I have been Vegan for 3 years and this is the best cupcake recipe I have made.
This is the best vegan cupcake I‚Äôve ever tasted!
Cut the recipe in half to make bite size mini cuppies...They are magic! I added cream cheese frosting

I added a homemade chai spice powder to the batter which added great flavor. Made it by mixing: 1 tsp ground ginger, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1/2 tsp ground cloves, 1/2 tsp ground cardamon, 1/2 tsp allspice, 1/2 tsp nutmeg. Also made a vegan buttercream icing with 1 stick of earth balance vegan butter, 2 cps powdered sugar, 1.5 tsp vanilla, 3 tbsp almond milk
The cupcakes themselves are a little dense. But the flavor is fantastic! Definitely will make again.
Failed! I used this recipe for mini-cupcakes. I thought it would bake faster, but they actually came out with a rock-hard shell and undercooked center (after way more time than the recipe said!)

I used gluten free flour and 1/2 whole milk 1/2 kefir for the milk/vinegar, otherwise followed the directions and they were great!!! The gluten free flour is the Cup4Cup multipurpose gluten free flour.

The only changes I made were coconut milk for the almond milk and I used distilled white vinegar in place of the ACV. These cupcakes were amazing! The texture was perfect, not dense like most other vegan cupcakes. I made a coconut cream chocolate frosting for these. I will definitely be making these again!
My husband was amazed that these cupcakes are dairy free.
this. The cupkes come out 100% according to the recipe. The slight change I made was adding 1 Tbsp of flaxseed and 1 Tbsp of quinoa flour.
LIKE THESE VERY MUCH WILL BE MAKING THEM AGAIN.

I made this as a trial for an order for a co-worker's son birthday. I was amazed! I used everything except I substituted Soy milk for the almond milk and I used canola oil instead of the coconut oil. it was light and fluffy and didn't have an aftertaste. I took the trial to my non-vegan co-workers to try without telling them they were vegan. They also liked them. The only con is they didn't rise and I think that was because of the lack of egg. I might try to use an egg replacement the next time. This is definitely a keeper.
It came out delicious! I put 1/4 of almond milk extra thou!
Excellent recipe! I used pea milk instead of almond milk and gluten free flour and they still turned out delicious! Easy to make and our entire family loves them - even the carnivores!

I made it as cupcakes and I made it as cake. I doubled the recipe and made a 4 layer 6inch cake. It was perfect. The cupcakes I made with almond milk, the cake with soy milk. I used the vanilla flavored ones with both. So moist, so yummy.
I made these for my assistant for her 1 year anniversary. Everyone is RAVING about them. "These don't taste vegan!" "What is in these, they're like magic!" It's been awesome.
Turned out chewy and sticky and tastes like dough instead of vanilla. Very bland and not as impressive as I expected from the reviews.
This recipe is amazing, very moist and flavorful!

Oh man.... TYPOS, guys!!! This recipe says 1 1/2 cups almond milk to 2 cups flour. That is WAY too much milk! Mine overflowed in the oven and turned into a disaster. Next time, it should be 1/2 cup almond milk.
This is an absolutely phenomenal cupcake recipe. I used Duncan Hines icing (shhhh!) and they turned out perfectly baked. Perhaps the most moist cake I‚Äôve ever made, and impossibly easy to make.
i only changed the extract to almond and they were AMAZING!!!
Great recipe! For my second batch, I reduced the flour to one cup and added a half cup of shredded coconut with a couple drops of coconut extract. Delicious! They were a hit.

These cupcakes are sooooo good. I found this recipe after having a real big craving for cupcakes and they turned out amazing! They are so light and fluffy and when they are warm they are even better. My batch made about 16 cupcakes but of course this differs between how much you fill your tins. I used cupcake liners and they popped out of each liner super easily when ready to eat(almost too easily, I almost dropped one!). And they are very easy to make, because the ingredients are things that can be easily found around the house. Although instead of using coconut oil, I opted for using vegetable oil and it worked out splendidly! Even if you aren't vegan I really think these cupcakes are worth making!
Awesome, did a chocolate vegan icing. Delicious and easy!
They did not rise!!

This is my first time making vegan cupcakes. I was a bit worried because the recipe note at the top stated that they don‚Äôt raise like regular cupcakes. I am an avid baker, and thought maybe it would help the rising process if I sifted the flour and sugar. Oh my they turned out beautiful. They raised perfectly, and tasted scrumptious. I even filled the cupcakes with pie filling apples before baking. I love your recipe, and will for sure use this over and over.
Turned out fantastic and moist! Nicely domed tops too.

I'm not vegan but I'm so glad I tried this recipe -- I had lots of almond milk on hand so I looked for a recipe with this milk. This recipe is a keeper. I followed the recipe exactly and was very pleasantly surprised. Here are a couple things I would note for myself next time: the cider vinegar and almond milk didn't curdle as I thought it should, even after leaving it for twice as long. That said, it didn't seem to make a difference to the final outcome. The other note for next time is to reduce the sugar by 1/4 cup (1 3/4 cup total). Thank you for sharing this recipe.
Yummy! It made 18 cupcakes & baked for 16minuites. Used French Vanilla instead of vanilla

These turned out perfectly! I must admit that I made changes and I am only commenting in case somebody didn't need these to be fully vegan. I only needed them to be egg-free so I used buttermilk instead of almond milk and vinegar, and butter instead of coconut oil. I will definitely be using this recipe again for egg-free treats for school!

(It was that bad i bothered to make an account)
Made it as is written.
Very accurately and it just wasn't good...
Maybe my standards are too high but those cupcakes felt like cheap preserved cupcakes with a taste and aftertaste of preservatives...
I really hoped this recipe will turn out great.
Though, the search continues...

It was so moist and delicious. I used monk fruit sugar instead of regular sugar for health reasons. Some one said they were dense, not light and fluffy. But I didnt mind at all. I made them for a birthday party and my son wanted to eat all of them lol. I will make this again.
Super easy and taste better than non-vegan cupcakes. This is my go to recipe for cupcakes now.
I was scrolling down this website (because I clicked on an add by accident) and saw this. However, I am not vegan, but it inspired me to make cupcakes, and they were good. 5/5

I'm not vegan but my niece is so I was looking for a cupcake recipe for her wedding shower. These cupcakes are delicious, moist and flavorful. They were a hit with all of the guests and I agree with another reviewer about being a go-to recipe.

Excellent recipe! Unlike many vegan bakery recipe epic fails where the chemistry doesn‚Äôt allow the baked goods to rise properly or the taste is ‚Äúoff,‚Äù these plumped up nicely and were soft, cakey, and delicious. Top with Allrecipe ‚ÄúButtercream Icing,‚Äù subbing Earth Balance for butter and soy milk for milk.
Really, really, tasty, 10/10. Highly recommend.

Soooo good! But I tried to fit all of the batter into just 12 cups, and that was overambitious. :-D (It took ~24 minutes to cook through.) I'm not even vegan, but the reviews praised these so highly that I had to try 'em. I'm glad I did!

Super easy, fast, and easy to divide or double the recipe. I made it using 1/3 of the ingredients to make 6 cupcakes. Since I‚Äôm plant based and celiac, I used Bob‚Äôs Red Mill 1:1 all purpose GF flour mix (with the blue labeling-the red has too much garbanzo bean flour and no xanthan gum in the mix), and soy milk. For the ‚Äúbuttercream‚Äù I used Earth Balance/vanilla/organic powdered sugar/matcha green tea powder. I‚Äôll definitely be making this recipe again!

I've experimented with different milks and oils and they are all good. My favorite is whole milk and coconut oil, vegetable oil works fine too. Remember to warm up the milk if you use coconut oil otherwise it will become a messy clump when it hits the cold milk.
Even though I changed it up a bit with brown sugar & wheat flower, the cupcakes are really tasty :-)

I didn't curdle the almond milk, and the recipe came out great--filled the cupcakes with morello cherries and topped them with dark chocolate chips instead of frosting (because we're not frosting-type people), and even the husband, who is a meat-and-potatoes kind of guy proclaimed them as delicious. They are. Never going back to the egg-based kind.

Honestly the best cupcakes I‚Äôve ever had. They are sooo fluffy and soft it‚Äôs crazy. They taste absolutely gorgeous too and I will never use another vanilla cupcake recopie again; this one is just too good!!

Absolutely delicious! Very moist and great flavor. Made a simple chocolate glaze with powdered sugar, cocoa, almond milk, and vanilla extract. I used all the batter for 12 cupcakes rather than 24 and they were perfect.
Amazing cupcakes. They are moist and have a delicious lighter taste, not as overly sweet, as ordinary cupcakes. Will definitely be my 'go to' recipe moving forward.

I used vegetable oil instead of coconut. I also threw in a handful of sprinkles right before putting them in the muffin tin to make ‚Äúfunfetti‚Äù cupcakes. These were so tasty and nobody knew they were vegan! Will definitely make this again. I was nervous that you would be able to smell the apple cider vinegar but you couldn‚Äôt at all.

This is a great recipe. I didn't have vanilla almond milk so I used chocolate almond milk instead and added a couple tablespoons of cocoa powder to turn them into chocolate cupcakes. They turned out delicious! they rose nicely. the cupcakes were very moist and tender. The Mr. didn't know they were vegan until I told him. He's pretty picky and even he was impressed! I will definitely use this again perhaps even as my go to cupcake recipe.
Not edible. Tasted like soggy vinegary dough. Tossed in the trash.
These were somehow better than non-vegan cupcakes. I used Angela Liddon's Spiced Buttercream Frosting from the Oh She Glows Every Day cookbook...wow. So good.

I live in NM and I had to bake for 25 minutes and they came out perfect! Next time I may even bake at 375 degrees to brown a little. Next time I'm adding chocolate chips. I think these cupcakes are way better than regular ones.

The perfect basic vegan cupcake recipe. It rises well unlike other recipes. I used way more vanilla than what the recipe called for, and used sunflower oil instead of coconut oil. Topped it off with vegan lemon buttercream frosting and it was AMAZING!

Tasted great! I would like to use liquid coconut oil next time since the solid clumped back together when added to the almond milk mixture. The cakes still turned out but there were a few small holes where the oil clumps melted.

The wet ingredients amounted to wat more than needed with the dry ingredients and I had to add extra flour. The flavor profile is completely off and the cupcakes did not rise above cupcake holders. Cooking time was much longer than 15 to 20 minutes.

My family loves these cupcakes. Made them for a party and everyone ate these instead of the non-vegan chocolate cupcakes. I've made them a few times now and always a huge hit. Making them again tonight for my daughters 18th bday. ;)
Wow!!! I used pure all cane sugar and HEB almond milk. It was very Delicious!
Followed recipe but added coco powder, not sure if these made the cupcakes heavy I'm thinking yes. Still not bad I will add a vegan frosting to them.. I will try the recipe again.
I made this and added 1 cup finely chopped carrots, 1 teaspoon cinnamon & 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves. Extremely moist & yummy
I just made these delicious cupcakes ! So easy to make especially with kids in house. I never tasted a cupcake like this ! Will always use this recipe .

My dairy free son can enjoy cupcakes again! This is a good recipe that I will make again. I suspect it may be better than our experience because I had to use gluten free flour. Initially I was underwhelmed with the final result but I tried another one the next day and it was much better! I think the flour I've been using needs time to absorb the moisture and soften up a bit.
Better than conventional recipe. Super moist and delicious!
Very nice flavor but the texture was dense and lacked the desired light fluffiness of cakes. (Made no changes to recipe, followed exactly)

Did a bit of substitution. Portion all stayed the same. Used whey protein powder as the milk (its all I had, as I don't drink any milk regularly), used brown sugar, used whole wheat flower, I added a 1/2 teaspoon more of baking powder, used a sifter to blend all the dry ingredients with exception of the sugar-added that after, used canola oil as I did not have coconut oil. Didn't use the apple cider. Didn't have cupcake pan so I made it into a few small loafs. I got a normal rise out of the cakes. I over cooked it a bit though to get a nice crunchy shell, all at 350 degrees started the timer at 30 minutes added 10 to 15 minutes accordingly to get the outside a nice firm shell, I started monitoring the oven at the 25 minute mark. I made sure to constantly check the center to make sure it baked all the way through. cool completely before you taste. Very tasty, nice shell, soft and fluffy on the inside. This would taste great if it had nuts. I didn't use a blender, I whisked and then used a wooden spoon.
Love it
Vegan cupcakes - oh my what next? Unicorn pancakes? Rainbow popcorn? Feminist fudge? Get a slab of steak, some peppercorn sauce and get a life!

Great vegan cupcakes, although mine were more like muffins. I put 1/2 and 1/2 whole wheat flour and white flour. As well, 1/2 and 1/2 brown sugar and white sugar. Also added some cashews, chia and cranberries. Absolutely delicious!

Was super anxious at the thought of making this since I almost never bake. I substituted the almond milk for soy and it actually came out wonderfully! I also used cinnamon over the icing as a light garnish. :) Will be making this again!
I have made this recipe before and, it is amazing! They don't taste like traditional cupcakes but they are just as tasty
Very nice and moist! I would recommend adding something aromatic in addition to the vanilla, such as orange zest, cinammon or liquer, as they are a bit flat.
Wonderfully light and fluffy!
This recipes was great. My little sister felt like some cupcakes and, feeling inspired, I made her these. They tasted great, especially for a vegan recipe

This recipe turned out so delicious! I wanted them to be chocolate cupcakes so I only used 1.5 cups of flour and then used .5 cup of cocao powder and they turned out so moist and chocolatey. I also used olive oil in place of the coconut oil.
Very good!! I'd rather use Vanilla Almond Milk for a much better taste. However, it is a bit soggy and not as tough as a regular cupcake.

This recipe is amazingly easy, moist and delicious! I've made two batch for cupcake centerpiece for my engagement party and it turned out beautifully, no crack, flat top, delicious moist cake. Everyone complimented me for the delicious cupcakes. Trust what the reviewers said and give this recipe a try. One thing I like to add that you should mix it well until the sugar dissolved properly to prevent some cupcake being too sweet from the other. I kind of mix it a bit too little so the last few cupcake from the batter is too sweet.

I've been looking for a decent vegan vanilla cupcake recipe for quite some time. I think I finally found it. This is by far the best vegan vanilla cupcake I've ever had. The only changes I made to the recipe was to use organic refined coconut oil instead of unrefined because I didn't want a coconut flavor. I also stirred the melted coconut oil into the flour mixture before adding the milk because I've had issues in the past with coconut oil solidifying when added to cold liquid... other than that the recipe was prepared as instructed. Made 17 cupcakes....definitely will make this recipe again and again.

My little guy was diagnosed with a severe dairy allergy so I've been looking for a non-dairy cake recipe for quite some time. I came across this and figuerd why not... it looks like it will work. I did everything EXACTLY as stated in the recipe. Knowing that the coconut oil was being mixed in with the almond milk then with the dry ingredients, I made sure to wait to warm up the oil until I was ready for it. The cupcakes were light and fluffy. Two out of 18 cupcakes turned out a bit dense but that may have been placement in the oven. Other than that everything was perfect. Little man absolutely loved it. He and his older brother devoured all of the cupcakes. I'll definitely be making these again.

Finally! I've been searching for a good, basic vanilla cake recipe. The recipe was simple to follow and they baked up light and fluffy! This time around I substituted rum extract and topped with eggnog buttercream for the holidays. the possibilities are endless!

I was making these for a dairy free friend, so I did whip one egg white and add at the end. Also, added sprinkles. Heated the oven to 400 degrees F and then turned down to 350 degrees F when I put the cupcakes in the oven (a trick to help them get the nice rounded top). Will add a little more vanilla next time to give them a stronger vanilla flavor, but they turned out excellent! I will make them again!
